etymologies: late 15th century (in the sense ‘symbol, emblem’): from French, or from Latin typus, from Greek tupos ‘impression, figure, type’, from tuptein ‘to strike’. The use in printing dates from the early 18th century; the general sense ‘category with common characteristics’ arose in the mid 19th century

definitions: a category of people or things having common characteristics

examples.text: this type of heather grows better in a drier habitat

shortDefinitions: category of people or things having common characteristics

definitions: a person, thing, or event considered as a representative of a type

examples.text: it's not the type of car I'd want my daughter to drive

shortDefinitions: person, thing, or event considered as representative of such category

definitions: a person of a specified character or nature
shortDefinitions: person of specified character or nature

definitions: the sort of person one likes or finds attractive
shortDefinitions: sort of person one likes or finds attractive

definitions: a person or thing symbolizing or exemplifying the ideal or defining characteristics of something

examples.text: she characterized his witty sayings as the type of modern wisdom

shortDefinitions: person or thing exemplifying ideal or defining characteristics of something

definitions: an object, conception, or work of art serving as a model for subsequent artists.
shortDefinitions: object, conception, or work of art serving as model for subsequent artists

definitions: a person or event in the Old Testament taken as a foreshadowing of someone or something in the New Testament.
shortDefinitions: person or event in Old Testament taken as foreshadowing of person or thing in New Testament

definitions: an organism or taxon chosen as having the essential characteristics of its group.
shortDefinitions: organism or taxon chosen as having essential characteristics of its group
characters or letters that are printed or shown on screen

definitions: a piece of metal with a raised letter or character on its upper surface, for use in letterpress printing.
shortDefinitions: piece of metal with raised letter or character on its upper surface, for use in letterpress printing

definitions: the pieces of metal used in letterpress printing collectively

examples.text: the first European printing of books began in 1454 with the invention of movable type

shortDefinitions: metal types used in letterpress printing

definitions: a design on either side of a medal or coin.
shortDefinitions: design on either side of medal or coin

definitions: an abstract category or class of linguistic item or unit, as distinct from actual occurrences in speech or writing.
shortDefinitions: abstract category or class of linguistic item or unit

definitions: write (something) on a typewriter or computer by pressing the keys

examples.text: he typed out the second draft
I am learning how to type

shortDefinitions: write something on typewriter or computer by pressing keys

definitions: determine the type to which (a person or their blood or tissue) belongs
